page.title: 12Water supply in South Fylde
page.content:
The Fylde district was{first {supplied}with water in l864 by the {Fylde Waterworks Company,}replaced by the{Fylde Water Board}(now merged into the{North West Water Authority)}in l897.
{Reservoirs}were built at{Weeton}in l866 and at{Westby}in 1929. Both are covered, circular in shape and supplied from reservoirs further north.
Weeton can hold 16 million gallons of water and supplies the I.C.I. works at Thornton and the St Annes area.
Westby holds 38 million gallons. Its area at top water level is 7.6 acres and the maximum depth is 25 ft. It supplies south Blackpool. A pump boosts outgoing supply if required.
